Name: Head of Akhenaten
Description: King Akhenaten made religious and social reforms and changed the Amun-Re cult into that of the Aten. This statue was once a part of a standing statue depicting the king with his head topped by feathers, symbol of Maat and Aten. Akhenaten appears here with his characteristic features that include long, tapering half-closed eyes with heavy eyelids, long delicate nose, immense protruding mouth, exaggerated chin, harsh musculature, long ears with pierced lobes, and two outlined wrinkle lines on the neck.
